comments.text:
+WoodFINgerboard13 the powerful presence of the "kpop industry" is 
practically inseparable from the product of it. From the consequences of 
poor/low-budget promotions to the effect it has on the idols themselves, 
it's something that permeates the entire career of basically every idol 
who's ever tried to make it big in S. Korea's pop music industry. The only 
group I've ever seen who manages to basically completely divorce themselves 
from that whole side of the music is Crayon Pop but they're a huge outlier 
on almost every level of their operation

comments.text: Everything would be different if their company was SM. ﻿
comments.author: Hyuna Yana

comments.text:
+Christy Chan If you would scroll up and read what happened earlier in this 
comment thread, you'd see that someone said "SM is shit" and treats their 
artists badly, and I replied to explain that Star Empire treats artists 
worse, which they do. 
SJ and TVXQ controversies were pre-2009, and since then, it seems as though 
things have improved a lot. I'm not saying that SM is good or fair- like I 
said earlier, JYP and YG are way better at treating their artists fairly. 
But look at Sulli's situation: she was getting hate and even though she 
wasn't physically injured, SM let her take a break from promotions because 
she wasn't feeling well emotionally. Watch the documentary on Star Empire. 
They don't even treat their artists like humans.
Also, there are a few articles about Luhan's earnings so I'll just link 
this forum post that has a source:
http://www.allkpop.com/forums/discussion/205690/luhan-only-earned-498-000-usd-while-promoting-with-exo

And yes, there are unconfirmed rumours that Tao is leaving EXO. However, 
Tao didn't *want* to leave EXO, and only is doing so out of respect to his 
father.
comments.author: Lillium Goulding

comments.text:
+Lillium Goulding What about SJ and TVXQ members?? They are left permanent 
injuries. Plus I am not saying Star Empire treat their artists well. I am 
just saying SM is not a good example of treating artist well. If you want 
to even compare, there are CEO of certain companies, who even sexually 
abuse their female artists. SM may have better promotion strategies, but I 
bet lots of artists want to leave the company, but they can't, afraid that 
SM would do the same things to them they did with JYJ. And btw, last artist 
left is now Tao, not Luhan. Lastly I would like to have a reliable source 
on the money SM paid Luhan.﻿ Money is not everything we or artists need to 
live on, you know.
comments.author: Christy Chan

comments.text:
+Christy Chan The last artist who left was Luhan. It's true that he got 
sick and injured. But do you know how much he got paid in one year? Almost 
$500000 USD. Do you know how much Star Empire artists get paid? ALMOST 
NOTHING. Almost not enough to even LIVE on.
I know SM treats their artists unfairly. But it is 100% true that Star 
Empire treats their artists EVEN WORSE.
The leader of ZE:A got injured and could not perform for almost 2 years, 
and he didn't get paid A SINGLE CENT IN TWO WHOLE YEARS. Star Empire 
artists have it worse, for sure.
comments.author: Lillium Goulding

comments.text:
Have any one of you ever thought that if they under SM, not all of them can 
debut?? Go check SM's ex-trainees and you will see how many stars in kpop 
nowadays SM has let go of, best example:GD
comments.author: Christy Chan

comments.text:
+Lillium Goulding Then I think you know nothing about SM entertainment. 
Have you ever wondered why so many artists left?? Because of the unfair 
treatment. There had been reports of physical abuse and no sick leave. 
Moreover, money is not fairly divided.
comments.author: Christy Chan
